statement.p: Suppose you were standing on the \displaystyle{x}{y}-plane at the point \displaystyle{\left({6},{4},{0}\right)}, with the positive \displaystyle{z}-axis directed straight upward, and you were facing the \displaystyle{y}{z}-plane.
If you walked forward 5 units, turned \displaystyle{180} degrees to the right, walked forward 2 units, and then finally rose straight upward by 3 units, what would be your final position?
Give your answer as a point: (, , )

ol.li: After walking forward \displaystyle{5} units, you are at \displaystyle{\left({1},{4},{0}\right)}.
Then after turning \displaystyle{180} degrees to the right and walking forward \displaystyle{2} units, your coordinates are \displaystyle{\left({3},{4},{0}\right)}.
Finally, after rising straight upward by \displaystyle{3} units, your final coordinates are: \displaystyle{\left({3},{4},{3}\right)}
